metadata.title: CVE-2021-27921 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properly checked for a BLP container, and thus an attempted memory allocation can be very large.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-27921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 8.1.2-1
python3-pil.imagetk - 8.1.2-1
No subscription required

advisory.discovered_by: Jiayi Lin, Luke Shaffer, Xinran Xie, Akshay Ajayan

notes.note: mdeslaur> while this is mentioned in the 8.1.1 release notes, it doesn't seem to be mentioned in the CHANGES file, and I can't seem to locate the commits that fix this in 8.1.1 vs 8.1.0 This was actually fixed in 8.1.2.

criterions.comment: pillow package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1').
